methods_proposed.name: Naive Baseline Forecast
methods_proposed.description: Uses the last observed area value as the prediction for the next period
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_error

# Load data
df = load_dataframe('prepared_PLAN-TSK-002.parquet')

# Identify target column
target_col = [col for col in df.columns if 'Area' in col and '2024-25' in col][0]

# Split data by financial year
df['Year'] = df[target_col].str.split('-').str[0]  # Extract year from column name
train_df = df[df['Year'] <= '2021']
val_df = df[(df['Year'] >= '2022') & (df['Year'] <= '2023')]

# Naive forecast using previous year's value
train_values = train_df[target_col].values
val_values = val_df[target_col].values

# Predict using last observed value
naive_forecast = train_values[-1]

# Calculate metrics
mae = mean_absolute_error(val_values, [naive_forecast]*len(val_values))
print(f'Naive Forecast MAE: {mae}')

methods_proposed.name: Linear Regression with Seasonal Features
methods_proposed.description: Linear regression model using YoY change and seasonal dummy variables
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
df = load_dataframe('prepared_PLAN-TSK-002.parquet')

# Identify target and features
target_col = [col for col in df.columns if 'Area' in col and '2024-25' in col][0]
feature_cols = ['YoY_change_2023-24', 'Season_Kharif', 'Season_Rabi', 'Season_Summer']

# Split data
df['Year'] = df[target_col].str.split('-').str[0]
train_df = df[df['Year'] <= '2021']
val_df = df[(df['Year'] >= '2022') & (df['Year'] <= '2023')]

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(train_df[feature_cols], train_df[target_col])

# Predict and evaluate
val_pred = model.predict(val_df[feature_cols])
rmse = mean_squared_error(val_df[target_col], val_pred, squared=False)
print(f'Linear Regression RMSE: {rmse}')

methods_proposed.name: Random Forest with Feature Engineering
methods_proposed.description: Ensemble model using all available features including historical area values
methods_proposed.implementation_code:
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_absolute_percentage_error

# Load data
df = load_dataframe('prepared_PLAN-TSK-002.parquet')

# Identify target
target_col = [col for col in df.columns if 'Area' in col and '2024-25' in col][0]

# Create lag features
for i in range(1, 4):
    df[f'Area_Lag_{i}'] = df[target_col].shift(i)

# Split data
df['Year'] = df[target_col].str.split('-').str[0]
train_df = df[df['Year'] <= '2021']
val_df = df[(df['Year'] >= '2022') & (df['Year'] <= '2023')]

# Train model
model = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(train_df.drop(columns=[target_col, 'Year']), train_df[target_col])

# Predict and evaluate
val_pred = model.predict(val_df.drop(columns=[target_col, 'Year']))
mape = mean_absolute_percentage_error(val_df[target_col], val_pred)
print(f'Random Forest MAPE: {mape}')

data_split_strategy: Train: 2015-2021 (6 years), Validation: 2022-2023 (2 years), Test: 2023-2024 (1 year)
data_preprocessing_steps: Identify target column as the latest Area-YYYY-MM column
Extract year from target column name for temporal splitting
Split data into train (≤2021), validation (2022-2023), test (2023-2024)
Create lag features for Random Forest model
Ensure no missing values in target column
